title: ToolHive MCP Server Registry Schema
description: JSON Schema for the ToolHive MCP server registry. This schema validates the structure and content of registry.json entries for MCP servers. See docs/registry/management.md and docs/registry/heuristics.md for inclusion criteria and management processes.

last_updated.description: Timestamp when the registry was last updated, in RFC3339 format

servers.description: Collection of MCP server entries indexed by server name

remote_servers.description: Collection of remote MCP server entries indexed by server name

groups.description: Collection of group definitions containing related MCP servers

args.description: Default command-line arguments passed to the MCP server container

custom_metadata.description: Custom user-defined metadata for the MCP server, primarily for custom registries

description.description: Human-readable description of the server's purpose and functionality

docker_tags.description: Available Docker tags for this server image

env_vars.description: Environment variables that can be passed to the server

image.description: Container image reference for the MCP server

metadata.description: Additional information about the server such as popularity metrics

name.description: Identifier for the MCP server, used when referencing the server in commands (auto-generated from the object key)

title.description: Optional human-readable display name for the server. If not provided, the name field is used for display.

overview.description: Longer Markdown-formatted description for web display. Unlike the description field (limited to 500 chars), this supports full Markdown and is intended for rich rendering on catalog pages.

permissions.description: Security profile and access permissions for the server

repository_url.description: URL of the source code repository for the server

status.description: Current status of the server (Active or Deprecated)

tags.description: Categorization tags for search and filtering

target_port.description: Port for the container to expose (applicable to SSE and Streamable HTTP transports)

proxy_port.description: Port for the HTTP proxy to listen on (host port). If not specified, a random available port will be assigned

tier.description: Tier classification of the server, (Official or Community)

tools.description: List of tool names provided by this MCP server

tool_definitions.description: Full MCP Tool definitions describing the tools available from this server, including name, description, inputSchema, and annotations

transport.description: Communication transport protocol used by the MCP server

environment_variable.description: Environment variable definition for MCP server configuration

description.description: Human-readable explanation of the variable's purpose

required.description: Whether this environment variable is required for the server to function

secret.description: Whether this environment variable contains sensitive information that should be stored as a secret

default.description: Value to use if the environment variable is not explicitly provided (only used for non-required variables)

permissions.description: Security permissions applied to the MCP server

read.description: File system paths the server needs read access to (will be mounted from the host)

write.description: File system paths the server needs write access to (will be mounted from the host)

privileged.description: Whether the container should run in privileged mode. When true, the container has access to all host devices and capabilities. Use with extreme caution as this removes most security isolation.

network_permissions.description: Network access permissions for the MCP server

allow_host.description: Allowed hostnames or domain patterns for outbound connections

allow_port.description: Allowed port numbers for outbound connections

insecure_allow_all.description: Whether to allow all outbound connections (insecure, use with caution)

metadata.description: Metadata about the MCP server from external sources

last_updated.description: Timestamp when the metadata was last updated, in RFC3339 format

provenance.description: Software supply chain provenance information for verified servers

repository_uri.description: Repository URI used for provenance verification

repository_ref.description: Repository reference used for provenance verification

runner_environment.description: Build environment where the server was built

signer_identity.description: Identity of the signer for provenance verification

sigstore_url.description: Sigstore TUF repository host for provenance verification

header.description: HTTP header definition for remote MCP server authentication

description.description: Human-readable explanation of the header's purpose

required.description: Whether this header is required for the server to function

secret.description: Whether this header contains sensitive information that should be stored as a secret

default.description: Value to use if the header is not explicitly provided (only used for non-required headers)

choices.description: List of valid values for the header

oauth_config.description: OAuth/OIDC configuration for remote server authentication

issuer.description: OAuth/OIDC issuer URL for OIDC discovery

authorize_url.description: OAuth authorization endpoint URL (for non-OIDC OAuth)

token_url.description: OAuth token endpoint URL (for non-OIDC OAuth)

use_pkce.description: Whether to use PKCE for the OAuth flow

oauth_params.description: Additional OAuth parameters to include in the authorization request (server-specific parameters like 'prompt', 'response_mode', etc.)

callback_port.description: Specific port to use for the OAuth callback server

remote_server.description: Remote MCP server entry definition accessed via HTTP/HTTPS

name.description: Identifier for the remote MCP server (auto-generated from the object key)

title.description: Optional human-readable display name for the server. If not provided, the name field is used for display.

overview.description: Longer Markdown-formatted description for web display. Unlike the description field (limited to 500 chars), this supports full Markdown and is intended for rich rendering on catalog pages.

url.description: Endpoint URL for the remote MCP server

description.description: Human-readable description of the server's purpose and functionality

tier.description: Tier classification of the server (Official or Community)

status.description: Current status of the server (Active or Deprecated)

transport.description: Communication transport protocol used by the remote MCP server

tools.description: List of tool names provided by this MCP server

tool_definitions.description: Full MCP Tool definitions describing the tools available from this server, including name, description, inputSchema, and annotations

headers.description: HTTP headers for authentication to the remote server

repository_url.description: URL of the source code repository for the server

tags.description: Categorization tags for search and filtering

custom_metadata.description: Custom user-defined metadata for the remote MCP server

group.description: Group definition containing related MCP servers that can be deployed together

name.description: Identifier for the group, used when referencing the group in commands

description.description: Human-readable description of the group's purpose and functionality

servers.description: Collection of MCP server entries within this group indexed by server name

remote_servers.description: Collection of remote MCP server entries within this group indexed by server name
